page.title: 19Farming around Heybridge
page.content: The area has a history of farming, and until recently{Bentall's,}who made one of the most important developments in the plough, were still an active concern in Heybridge. The soil around Heybridge is dry because there is much gravel under the surface so the water tends to drain away very rapidly. So the farmers in the area have constructed reservoirs to provide a ready supply of water for their animals and crops. Although there is some livestock farming locally, by far the most common type of farming is arable. There are some peas and rape grown, but the greatest crops are wheat and barley which we estimate to comprise around 80% of the crops grown.
